item.title: Version 1.3.3
item.description:
Retext 1.3.3

What's New in v1.3.3

Improvements

  • Better License Activation — License key entry is now at the top of the upgrade window, no scrolling needed
    • ---

    v1.3.2

    Improvements

  • Clearer Upgrade Messaging — Updated in-app Pro upgrade prompts with benefit-focused copy
    • ---

    v1.3.1

    Bug Fixes

  • Fixed Checkout Links — Updated all purchase/upgrade links to the correct checkout page
    • ---

    v1.3.0

    New Branded App Icon

  • Fresh Look — New green logo with white "R" matches the retext.io website
  • Better Recognition — Stand out in your Dock and app switcher

    • Enhanced About Window

  • Credits — Retext menu → About Retext now shows tagline and website link
  • Copyright — Displays "© 2024-2026 Retext. All rights reserved."

    • Snippet Settings

  • Max Title Length — Set your preferred limit (10-40 characters) in Settings
  • Auto-Remove Spaces — Spaces are automatically stripped from titles (toggle in Settings)
  • Cleaner Titles — Semicolons are automatically removed from titles

    • Improved Validation

  • Instant Feedback — Errors and warnings now appear directly under the title as you type
  • Conflict Prevention — Can't create triggers that would conflict (e.g., "em" and "email")
  • Helpful Suggestions — When blocked, see alternative trigger names you can use
  • Friendlier Messages — Shorter, clearer error messages

    • Better Editing Experience

  • Type Triggers Freely — Snippet expansion is disabled when editing in Retext
  • No Accidental Triggers — Type `;hello` in your content without it expanding
    • ---

    Previous Releases

    v1.2.x — Automatic Updates

  • Automatic update notifications on app launch

    • v1.1.x — Tag-Based Organization

  • New three-panel layout with tags sidebar
  • Add tags to snippets for organization
  • Filter snippets by tag

    • v1.0.x — Initial Release

  • NavigationSplitView layout with sidebar
  • Tinted button styles and hover effects
  • Infinite loop prevention and snippet validation
  • Keyboard shortcuts: ⌘E to edit, ⌘↩ to save, Esc to cancel
